businessmodel.observer

Interface Subject

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AssemblyLine, OrderManager, Scheduler

    public interface Subject
    An interface that can be implemented by a class to utilize the observer design pattern. The interface implementation is preferable over the standard java implementation because it adheres more to the design to an interface guideline and allows for more control.
    Author:
    SWOP team 10 2013-2014

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void notifyObservers()
      Notifies all the observers.
      void subscribeObserver(Observer observer)
      Registers a new observer which will be notified every time important data of the subject is changed.
      void unsubscribeObserver(Observer observer)
      Removes an observer from the subject.

    • Method Detail

      • subscribeObserver

        void subscribeObserver(Observer observer)
        Registers a new observer which will be notified every time important data of the subject is changed.
        Parameters:
        observer - The new observer who wants to be notified by the subject.

      • unsubscribeObserver

        void unsubscribeObserver(Observer observer)
        Removes an observer from the subject.
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer who no longer wants to be notified.

      • notifyObservers

        void notifyObservers()
        Notifies all the observers.
